monster.name: Tanarean Pegasus

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
The tanarean pegasus is a stunning creature, known for its striking beauty and natural grace. This breed of pegasus boasts an impressive wingspan of up to 20 feet, making it a highly coveted mount for those seeking swift transportation and superior strength. However, training and handling this creature can present unique challenges. The tanarean pegasus lacks the intelligence of its regular pegasus counterpart, making it skittish and difficult to gain trust and obedience from. These instincts of self-preservation and tendency to flee can make the training process longer and more complicated.
To train a tanarean pegasus successfully, a trainer must create a secure and comfortable environment, introduce it to other trained mounts to develop socialization skills, and establish trust through consistent, patient handling and training. Despite these challenges, the tanarean pegasus is a valuable asset in Tanares, with its beauty, strength, and speed making it a worthy mount for those willing to put in the effort to train it.
Cost to training and Flying Points: Base: 6 Flying Points Monthly Cost | Extra Flying Points 20 gp | +1d6 50 gp | +2d6 80 gp | +3d6 120 gp | +4d6
Flying Maneuvers:
Rescue (2 FP). You can save an ally from falling. Use your reaction to fly to an ally that is falling within your flying range and hold them in the air. Apply only if another flying mounted enemy caused the falling.
Dive (2 FP). Using your mount's flight superiority, you quickly get out of the way of danger. You can take a reaction when you succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against an effect from another flying mounted enemy that would cause you to take half damage, such as fireball, to take no damage from the effect.
Flight Tenacity (4 FP). You know the dangerous movements of mounted enemies that would make you fall from the griffon. Whenever you or your mount would begin to fall due to an effect caused by a flying-mounted enemy, you can use this maneuver as a reaction to prevent the fall, considering a failed saving throw or ability check, if any, as a success.
Aerial Sprint (2 FP). The pegasus' instinct takes over and it charges against the mounted creature. As a bonus action, the mount gains extra flying speed for the current turn. The increase equals twice its flying speed (after applying any modifiers), but the mount must move toward a target flying-mounted enemy.
Inspiring Flying (3 FP). All allies gain 2 Flying Points. The mount regains this use after finishing a short or long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 296 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Tanarean Griffon

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: Keen Sight: The griffon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The griffon makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Beak: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Claws: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

monster.description:
The tanarean griffon is a fearsome creature with the powerful body of a lion and the majestic wings and head of an eagle. With a more muscular body than a regular griffon, it is a formidable opponent in combat. Though the tanarean griffon lacks intelligence and magical abilities, it more than makes up for it with its ferocity and strength. This makes it a difficult creature to train and control, requiring a patient and skilled trainer to gain its trust and loyalty.
The tanarean griffon can be unpredictable and aggressive, with a tendency to assert dominance over weaker foes. To successfully train one, a trainer must establish their own dominance and earn the griffon's respect through consistent handling and training. Providing a secure and comfortable environment is crucial to developing the creature's trust and obedience. Despite its challenges, the tanarean griffon is a powerful and imposing creature that can serve as a mount or companion for those who are willing to put in the effort to train it.
Cost to training and Flying Points: Base: 6 Flying Points Monthly Cost | Extra Flying Points 25 gp | +1d6 60 gp | +2d6 90 gp | +3d6 130 gp | +4d6
Flying Maneuvers:
Flight Destabilization (3 FP). A powerfull bull rush that can unbalance flying mounted enemies. As an attack, you try to destabilize the target's flight. The target must make a Dexterity or Strength saving throw with DC = 8 + griffon's Strength modifier + proficiency bonus. If it fails, it plummets towards the ground.
Winged Resilience (3 FP). The griffon's agility can be very effective against flying mounted enemies. Spend Flying Points to reduce the damage inflicted by a flying mounted enemy's attack by 12 points.
Flight Tenacity (4 FP). You know the dangerous movements of mounted enemies that would make you fall from the griffon. Whenever you or your mount would begin to fall due to an effect caused by a flying-mounted enemy, you can use this maneuver as a reaction to prevent the fall, considering a failed saving throw or ability check, if any, as a success.
Aerial Sprint (2 FP). The griffon' instinct takes over and it charges against a target flying mounted enemy. As a bonus action, the mount gains extra flying speed for the current turn. The increase equals twice its flying speed (after applying any modifiers), but the mount must move toward a target flying-mounted enemy.
Fearsome Claws (3FP). Three enemies lose 2 Flying Points. The mount regains this use after finishing a short or long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 297 (Homebrew)

trait.text: The hippogriff has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

monster.description:
The tanarean hippogriff is a majestic creature with the body of a horse and the head and wings of an eagle. Like its regular hippogriff counterpart, it can grow up to 10 feet in length and possesses incredible speed and agility. However, the tanarean hippogriff lacks intelligence, making it challenging to train and control. It can be skittish and easily frightened, requiring a patient and skilled trainer to gain its trust and obedience.
To train a tanarean hippogriff successfully, a trainer must create a safe and comfortable environment and introduce the hippogriff to other trained mounts to develop socialization skills. The trainer must also establish trust through consistent handling and training. Despite its challenges, the tanarean hippogriff is a valuable and sought-after creature, prized for its speed, agility, and even beauty.
Cost to training and Flying Points: Base: 4 Flying Points Monthly cost | Extra Flying Points 15 gp +1d4 30 gp +2d4 50 gp +3d4 75 gp +4d4
Flying Maneuvers:
Flight Destabilization (3 FP). A powerfull bull rush that can unbalance flying mounted enemies. As an attack, you try to destabilize the target's flight. The target must make a Dexterity or Strength saving throw with DC = 8 + hippogriff 's Strength modifier + proficiency bonus. If it fails, it plummets towards the ground.
Rescue (2 FP). Observing the movement of the mounted enemy, you can save your ally from the falling. Use your reaction to fly to an ally that falls within your flying range and hold them in the air. Apply only it another mounted creature caused the falling.
Winged Resilience (3 FP). The griffon's claws can be very effective against flying mounted enemies. Spend Flying Points to reduce the damage inflicted by a flying mounted enemy's attack by 12 points.
Forced Landing (1 FP). When a flying mounted enemy makes your mount fall, you can use this maneuver to land safely on the ground without suffering any damage from falling. Your mount can take to the air again on your next turn.
Inner Strenght (3 FP). As a bonus action, you allow a creature to immediately use its reaction to make a maneuver using Flying Points, but with the cost reduced by 2. The mount regains this use after finising a short or long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 298 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Tanarean Desert Drake

trait.name: Assault
trait.text: If the desert drake moves at least 15 feet before it hits with a Bite attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 4 (1d8) additional piercing damage.

trait.name: Wild Accuracy
trait.text: For each other desert drake within 30 feet, this drake receives +1 on attack rolls (max +5).

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Necrotic Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The desert drake exhales necrotic energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must take a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description:
The drake is a formidable creature that strikes fear into the hearts of many adventurers. With its muscular body, sharp claws, and fiery breath, it is a formidable opponent in combat. The drake is a solitary beast that does not form bonds with others. This makes it difficult to train and control, as it will only obey those it is intimidated by. The drake is also intelligent and can be difficult to outsmart, requiring a trainer with considerable skill and experience. To gain dominance over a drake, a trainer must establish authority and maintain a constant level of intimidation. While firm vocalization and daunting body language are usually sufficient, drakes occasionally try to engage in fights to demonstrate physical superiority. Therefore, it will sometimes be necessary to resort to physical intimidation with them, but it must be administered carefully to avoid triggering a worse violent response. Once the drake has been subdued, it can be trained in a variety of techniques, such as hunting and aerial combat exercises.
Drakes are carnivorous creatures that feed on a variety of prey, such as mammals and other creatures of the sky. Their diet is essential to maintaining their physical strength and agility. Training a Drake is a dangerous and difficult task, but those who are able to successfully train one will have a loyal and powerful companion that will serve them well in any adventure.
Cost to training and Flying Points Base: 8 Flying Points Monthly cost | Extra Flying Points 50 gp | +1d8 120 gp | +2d8 250 gp | +3d8 500 gp | +4d8
Flying Maneuvers: Winged Resilience (3 FP). The drake's tough scales are highly effective against mounted enemies in the air. Spend Flying Points to reduce the damage inflicted by a flying mounted enemy's attack by 12 points.
Flight Destabilization (3 FP). A powerful bull rush that can unbalance even the most skilled flying mounted enemies.
As an attack, you to try to destabilize the target's flight. The target must make a Dexterity or Strength saving throw with DC = 8 + drake's Strength modifier + proficiency bonus. If it fails, it plummets towards the ground.
Flight Blindness (4 FP). This powerful maneuver weakens the connection between a flying mount and its rider. It generates a powerful wave that interferes with their flight, preventing the mounted enemy from using any Flying Points until the start of your next turn. The only way to avoid this effect is to spend 6 Flying Points.
Forced Landing (1 FP). When a flying mounted enemy makes your mount fall, you can use this maneuver to land safely on the ground without suffering any damage from falling. Your mount can take to the air again on your next turn.
Final Breath (5 FP). The Drake's fiery breath is a fearsome weapon against flying mounted enemies. When you use it, you can also utilize any of your Flying Maneuvers at no cost against one of the targets the breath is aimed at. The drake this use after finishing a short or long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 299 (Homebrew), Tanares Sourcebook p. 306 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Butler

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

monster.description:
The butler is the mainstay of your operation, responsible for maintaining the Headquarters with cleaning, organization, and caretaking services. Additionally, they provide support to the Adventure Team, acting as a receptionist for visitors and facilitating communication between the team and the rest of the Headquarters. By ensuring everything runs smoothly, the butler allows the Adventure Team to focus on their heroic pursuits.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 304 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Arcane Scholar

trait.name: Ritualistic
trait.text: When inside an Arcane Library of the Headquarters, the arcane scholar can cast 1st and 2nd level spells as rituals, provided that they have the ritual tag and the arcane scholar has a spellbook containing the spell.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Arcane scholar's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 11). The arcane scholar knows the following spells:
• Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation • 1st level (only ritual): detect magic, identify

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

monster.spells: Mage Hand, Prestidigitation, Detect Magic, Identify
monster.description:
The library is not just a collection of books and artifacts. It is also home to the arcane scholar, a dedicated staff member who compensates for their lack of combat ability with their vast knowledge of magic. Assigned to the Arcane Library, the arcane scholar is able to identify magic items, obtain components, and perform rituals, thus enhancing the library's capabilities and the Adventure Team's magical knowledge.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 305 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Breeder

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The breeder's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• 1/Day: animal friendship

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 +1) piercing damage.

action.name: Whip
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

monster.spells: Mage Hand, Prestidigitation, Detect Magic, Identify
monster.description:
With the aid of a skilled breeder, the stable staff, the Stables can not only provide care and training for the mounts but also produce offspring that can be sold for significant amounts of gold. The breeder possesses great empathy when dealing with animals and can even tame ever more powerful creatures as they gain experience.
To utilize the services of the breeder, the Stable structure is required. Whether it's a quick rest or a longer stay, the Stable is the perfect place to keep your mounts safe and well taken care of while adventuring in the dangerous lands of Tanares.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 306 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Craftsman

trait.name: Profession (Crafter)
trait.text: The craftsman adds their proficiency bonus (+2) when using a tool (not supplies, kits or utensils) from the artisan's tools.

action.name: Light hammer
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
The craftsman is a skilled artisan who dedicates their callused hands and sweat-stained clothing to producing high-quality items and equipment from diverse materials. Their passion for their craft is only matched by their expertise, and they thrive in the Workshop's creative environment. They not only produce masterpieces but also generate value for the Adventure Team by selling their creations, making the Workshop an indispensable resource.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 307 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Tavern Keeper

trait.name: Profession (Chef)
trait.text: The tavern keeper adds their proficiency (+2) when using brewer's supplies or cook's utensils.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
The tavern keeper is the staff member in charge of the Tavern's operation, from serving customers to managing inventory and finances. With their expertise, they know how to handle unruly patrons and entice new customers with alluring deals. As the tavern's profits grow, the tavern keeper's skills develop, and they can increase the establishment's earnings and make it a truly profitable venture for the Adventure Team.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 308 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Doctor

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
The doctor's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• at will: light, spare the dying

trait.name: Treatment (1/Day)
trait.text: Creatures that take a short rest under the care of the doctor recover the maximum amount of hit points from the Hit Dice they spend during the rest. The doctor can treat up to 4 creatures at the same time with this ability.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage

action.name: First Aid (10/Day)
action.text: The doctor performs first aid on a humanoid creature that is not dead and has 0 hit points, restoring 1 hit point to it.

monster.description:
The doctor is a skilled healer who oversees the Healing Hall and tends to the injured and sick members of the team. Their expertise in medicine and healing magic is invaluable in restoring hit points to the PCs, ensuring they are ready for their next adventure. With each upgrade to the Healing Hall, the doctor gains access to more advanced medical tools and supplies, allowing them to better care for those in need.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 309 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Wayfinder

trait.name: Profession (Mapper)
trait.text: The wayfinder adds their proficiency (+2) when using calligrapher's supplies, cartographer's tools, or navigator's tools.

trait.name: Log Mind
trait.text: The wayfinder always knows the direction of north and the time of day

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands.

monster.description:
The wayfinder is a learned scholar who possesses knowledge of celestial bodies, space, and the land and its terrain, aiding the Adventure Team in their journeys. With expertise in astronomy and cartography, the wayfinder creates precise maps of the land and cosmos, predicts the alignment of stars, and performs magical feats to help the group navigate. As they continue to hone their skills, the wayfinder becomes an invaluable member of the Adventure Team, unlocking the secrets of the world around them.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 310 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Head Guard

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: The head guard has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

monster.description:
The head guard is the master of military defense for the Headquarters. With their vast knowledge of combat strategies, both in open fields and siege tactics, they ensure an unrivaled shield for the fortress. Their experience in training and leading soldiers is crucial for the recruitment and management of a strong defense force, ready to repel any threat to the Headquarters.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 311 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Farmer

trait.name: Natural Vitality
trait.text: The farmer has advantage on saving throws against exhaustion.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
The farmer is a seasoned expert in the art of cultivation and livestock management. With a keen sense of the land and its natural rhythms, they bring forth bountiful harvests and raise healthy livestock. Their expertise in managing the Farm ensures that the crops and animals continue to flourish and produce, providing an abundance of food and resources to support the community and the Adventure Team.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 312 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Curator

trait.name: Connoisseur
trait.text: The curator has advantage on any ability check to determine whether an archaeological or art piece is legitimate or imitation.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

monster.description:
Behind thick glasses and with one or two thick books always at their waist, the curator is the guardian of the Museum's vast collection. Responsible for guiding visitors through the halls and showcasing the Adventure Team's latest discoveries, they are also charged with studying ancient tomes to aid the group in their quest for precious artifacts. With an unwavering dedication to the protection of the Museum's treasures, the curator ensures that the Headquarters remains a place of knowledge for all adventurers.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 313 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Harbor Master

trait.name: Coast-born
trait.text: The harbor master has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks related to swimming.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

monster.description:
With a clipboard in hand, the harbor master oversees all arrivals and departures from the endless sea, ensuring a smooth operation of the Pier. Their management skills allow the Adventure Team to control larger vessels and increase their profits over time. The harbor master also spreads the word about the team's accomplishments to the taverns of the harbor district, earning them a reputation as successful traders and explorers.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 314 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Herbalist
monster.languages: Common, Sylvan, plus any one language

trait.name: Profession (Herbalist)
trait.text: The herbalist adds their proficiency bonus (+2) when using a herbalism kit.

trait.name: Speak with Plants
trait.text: The herbalist can communicate with plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description:
The herbalist is a skilled cultivator and alchemist, able to nurture and extract the purest potion or the most nefarious poison from the natural treasures of various regions. Their ability to cultivate and care for the plants in the Garden ensures that each vial is filled with a much stronger compound than usual, at a lower cost than standard. With an advanced herbalist, the Garden can produce rare and potent ingredients that can be used to create powerful magic items.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 315 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Heroic Staff

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: The heroic staff has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Determination
trait.text: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the heroic staff hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Training
trait.text: The Heroic Staff retains all previous abilities and proficiencies it had.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The heroic staff makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage. Versatility: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage

action.name: Shield Bash
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reaction.name: Block
reaction.text: The heroic staff gains a +3 bonus to Dexterity saving throws imposed by spells or area effects. To do so, the heroic staff must see the attacker or origin of effect and must be wielding a shield.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: The heroic staff adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the heroic staff must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.description: Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 317 (Homebrew)
